column4: I'm trying to mount an external harddrive on ubuntu server (hardy) - can anyone help?
Is the drive attached already?
Can you see it in /dev/???
is has a number of partitions but I see Disk /dev/sdb: 500.1 GB, 500107862016 bytes when I do fdisk-l
/dev/sdb will be the disk, then /dev/sdbN (1/2/3/etc) will be each partition
You want to start with `man mount`
Then something like `mount /dev/sdb1 /media/blah` :)
can I mount all partitions to one place (/media/store)
Each disk needs to be mounted in a different place
But they can all be within one folder if you like
- ok , how can I unmount?
`man umount`
`umount /media/blah`
- thanks!
- any idea about mounting ntfs partitions? - or partitions of which i dont know the filesystem
Do you have a specific error?
I can mount the first 3 partitions, the 4th is mac (i think called HFS extended) and the 4th is NTFS, I can mount with the -force switch both no directory listing
You need to read up on `man mount` about the different options for mounting different disk types
I don't know the specifics off the top of my head
- ok, I'm off to read the man pages. Thanks for your help :)
nw, good luck, try searching as well, you might find it quicker  :)
